title: Drawing, "Tequendama Falls near Bogota, Colombia", 1853
medium:
Recto:  Graphite, brush and oxidized white gouache on brown paper
Verso:  Graphite on brown paper
markings:
Recto:  Stamped in ink, at lower left: Lugt 457c

Verso:  Stamped in ink, at bottom center: Lugt 457d
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite with numbers at various locations; again at upper left:  This mountain has / a rather barren appearance / like one cleared as in the States; again, at upper right edge: yellow / brown; again, at center right:  Brown and grey / bushes; and at bottom right:   2 reddish green / 3 Yellowish grey / 4 grey / 5 reddish purple / 6 dark brown / 7 Blackish / warm / 8 Streak of salmon col[or]
description:
Recto:  Horizontal view of the falls seen in the distant background from across a valley with the river bed winding through to the foreground.

Verso:  Horizontal unfinished sketch of mountains.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Tequendama Falls near Bogota, Colombia", 1853.
1853. Recto:  Graphite, brush and oxidized white gouache on brown paper
Verso:  Graphite on brown paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-264.
